Title: Cashier/Caissier(ère) (Jour) (FT) - Laval, QC - Indeed.com
Description:
This position is from 10:30 to 4 pm, Monday to Friday. Kojax cashiers interact with our customers.
Duties:
As a cashier, you will accept the customer's order, provide meal suggestions to the customers, and accept payment.
A cashier will also prepare Ubereats orders for drivers to pick up and provide curbside pick-up for our customers.
From time to time cashiers will enter the kitchen to help prepare our customer's orders.
Minimum Requirement:
Cashiers must be bilingual.
Flexible schedules.
Cette poste est de 10 h 30 à 16 h du lundi au vendredi.
Les caissiers(ères) de Kojax interagissent avec nos clients. En tant que caissier(ère), vous accepterez la commande du client, lui proposerez des suggestions de repas et accepterez le paiement. Un caissier(ère) préparera également les commandes Ubereats pour que les chauffeurs les récupèrent et assurent le "curb-side pick-up" pour nos clients. De temps en temps, des caissiers(ères) entrent dans la cuisine pour aider à préparer les commandes de nos clients.
Les caissiers doivent être bilingues. Horaires flexibles.

Title: Customer service/Cashier - Montréal, QC - Indeed.com
Description:
Branche d'olivier recrute actuellement des caissiers à temps plein pour les magasins situés à Saint-Henri.
Vos principales responsabilités en tant que caissier(ère) dans l'un de nos magasins sont les suivantes :
Poinçonner et/ou scanner la marchandise en temps voulu.
Assurer l'exactitude des prix poinçonnés à l'aide des différents codes et effectuer les annulations selon les normes établies.
Assurer l'équilibrage de la caisse enregistreuse.
Recueillir et communiquer les suggestions des clients, les produits manquants et les erreurs de prix à son responsable.
Appliquer les procédures, politiques et normes de santé et de sécurité sur le lieu de travail.
Nettoyer les étagères et aider à la rotation des produits.
Réapprovisionner les produits.
Recevoir les livraisons.
Qualifications / compétences attendues
DES ou équivalent.
Minimum 1 an d'expérience dans le service à la clientèle.
Capacité à travailler avec un système de caisse enregistreuse électronique.
Compétences mathématiques de base.
Solides compétences en matière de service à la clientèle.
Sens des responsabilités et autonomie.
Bonne capacité de communication.
Esprit d'équipe.
Si vous êtes intéressé, veuillez envoyer votre CV par courriel. Nous embauchons dès que possible.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Branche d'olivier is currently hiring full-time cashier for stores located in Saint-Henri.
As a cashier, your main responsibilities are:
Punch and/or scan merchandise in a timely manner.
Ensure the accuracy of the prices punched using the various codes and make cancellations according to the established standards.
Ensure the balancing of the cash register.
Collects and communicates customer suggestions, missing products and pricing errors to his/her manager.
Apply procedures, policies and standards of health and safety in the workplace.
Cleaning shelves and helping with rotation of products.
Restocking products.
Receiving deliveries.
Expected Qualifications / Skills
DES or equivalent.
Minimum 1 year experience in customer service.
Ability to work with an electronic cash register system.
Basic mathematical skills.
Strong customer service skills.
Sense of responsibility and autonomy.
Good communication skills.
Team player.
Type d'emploi : Temps Plein, Permanent
Salaire : à partir de 14,50$ par heure
Horaire :
8 Heures
Télétravail:
Non

Title: Sales Associate (MR- Seasonal) - Osoyoos, BC - Indeed.com
Description:
Seasonal Sales Associate
Positions Available!
At the Liquor Distribution Branch (LDB) our vision of 'Service. Relationships. Results.' is all about providing a valued service, building strong relationships with our stakeholders, and achieving greater results for the province.
The LDB is one of two branches of government responsible for the cannabis and liquor industry of B.C. We operate the wholesale distribution of beverage alcohol within the province, as well as the household retail brand of BC Liquor Stores.
We employ nearly 5,000 people in over 200 communities and have been named one of BC's Top Employers 13 times over for offering exceptional places to work rooted in values of fairness and respect, work-life balance, and inclusion and diversity. We believe that our people are our greatest asset. Being a reputable employer with programs of skills training and professional development are what attract candidates to BC Liquor Stores, while our progressive, forward-thinking culture is why employees with a growth mindset thrive.
Seasonal positions are on-call, meaning hours of work are not guaranteed and subject to availability. Seasonal positions are temporary but can lead to Auxiliary opportunities.
We are dedicated to the highest quality of customer service, delivered with friendliness, individual pride, initiative, and retail passion! If you fit this description and you are prepared to work in a fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply to become a part of BC Liquor Stores.
To be eligible, applicants must meet the following qualification requirements:
Be at least 19 years of age
Be able to legally work in Canada
Be able to provide excellent customer service
Be able to communicate effectively and professionally with the public
Be able to demonstrate aptitude for cashier and related duties, including calculations
Be able to perform physically demanding work, including lifting 20-25 kg boxes
Have a valid Serving It Right Certificate
BC Liquor Store Sales Associates may be required to operate a variety of mechanical and hand-operated equipment, in addition to handling large volumes of bottles as part of the LDB's recycling program.
Rate of Pay as of April 11, 2021:Seasonal Sales Associate - $18.08 per hour.
Sales Associates must be available from July 1 through Labour Day and/or December 1 to 31 on an on-call basis. Shift work is required.
A Criminal Record Check is required.
On November 1, 2021 the BC Public Service announced the COVID-19 Vaccination Policy that defines the conditions and expectations for BC Public Service employees regarding vaccination against COVID-19. Among other possible measures, proof of vaccination will be required by November 22, 2021. It is a term of acceptance of employment that you agree to comply with all vaccination requirements that apply to the public service. More information can be found here:
https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/careers-myhr/all-employees/safety-health-well-being/health/covid-19/covid-19-vaccination-policy-for-bc-public-service-employees

Title: CASHIER - Vaughan, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Coppa’s Fresh Market is a family-owned and operated grocery chain in the GTA. Since 1963, we’ve been committed to providing a truly authentic grocery experience, where customers get exceptional value, great service, and great selection of the finest quality foods from around the corner and around the world!
Coppa’s Fresh Market offers an exciting workplace with opportunities to grow, learn and share. If you love creating an exceptional shopping experience and are driven by excellence, then we want to hear from you! Come grow your career with us and be part of our expansion initiative.
Our Customer Service department at our King City store is growing, and looking to add Cashiers to our team!
Responsibilities:
Greet customers in an engaging manner, connecting with them to ensure they’ve found everything they were looking for, and that they have enjoyed their shopping experience with us
Accurately and efficiently scan, process, and bag customer orders
Follow SmartServe guidelines when processing sale of alcohol
Accurately handle cash and EFT transactions
Provide customers with information on our unique offerings, sale items, and cross-selling opportunities
Provide management with feedback from customers
Maintain a clean and safe work environment, adhering to safety and sanitation policies
Must be available to work flexible shifts including evenings and weekends

Title: Gas Station Attendant/Cashier - Ottawa, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
Essential Functions / Major Responsibilities
Supervise and coordinate the activities of the station attendants/store keepers while responsible for running the daily operations of the site convenience store
Maintaining sufficient inventory and ordering routine merchandise
Formulate reports regarding merchandising, sales volumes and other matters
Sell merchandise to customers
Resolve customer complaints when needed
Promote and maintain a safe working environment and follow all company protocol
Prepare necessary paperwork and ensure accuracy of weekly sales audit
Handle cash and receipts for the sale of merchandise by performing duties such as counting the float, balancing cash, providing change, sorting and securing cash.
Perform other related duties as required.
Specific skills required for the position:
A least 2 year experience in operating Lottery machine
Ability to write routine reports and correspondence.
Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent
Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out detailed written or oral instructions.
Possess an understanding and working knowledge of MS Office suite to include Excel, Word, and Outlook.
Excellent oral/written communication skills
Education and Experience Requirements
Completion of secondary school is required.
Minimum three year of work experience as a cashier/attendant/stock worker in a retail sales environment is required. Supervisory experience in a similar work setting will be considered as an asset..

Supports the Store Leadership team by performing customer service activities including selling, completing transactions, and back

experience

operations, etc.
Contributes to a diverse and inclusive atmosphere free from discrimination and harassment, reflective of our People-First
philosophy

Business-minded trendsetter who understands today's ever-changing fashion landscape.

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Title: Kitchen Staff/Cashier - Ottawa, ON - Indeed.com
Description:
About us
Smoke's Poutinerie is the World's Largest & Original Poutinerie offering a broad menu exclusive to poutine.
The Smoke's Poutinerie Vision is to achieve GLOBAL DOMINATION by providing a Unique, Canadian Food Experience that will Entertain the World!!
Job Summary
As Band Member, You'll be center stage as you Entertain our Fans. Not only will you be serving Smoke's GASTRONIMICAL Poutine creations, but you'll Engage and Entertain customers turning them into loyal lifelong Fans! This could simply be sparking up a conversation, or maybe even challenging them to an EPIC AIR GUITAR BATTLE OF THE ROCK GODS! You get to decide how to Entertain each Fan and deliver on Smoke's vision of providing a Unique Canadian Food Experience as we move closer towards GLOBAL DOMINATION!
Core Responsibilities:
One must represent the Brand's Weird, Wild & Wacky Culture and demonstrate a commitment to Entertain Fans while providing the highest level of hospitality.
Contribute to a positive team environment
Knowledgeable about the menu and able to communicate this to Fans
Prepare Smoke's GASTRONIMICAL creations to the highest standards, following recipes and procedures
Maintain food quality control and productivity at all times
Adhere to safe food-handling procedures and uphold food safety practices
Take orders, enter into point-of-sale system and process payments
Maintain cleanliness of restaurant, restrooms and outer premises
Complete all stations set up and closing procedures
Demonstrate a sense of urgency when completing any task including serving Fans, preparing food items, cleaning, etc.
Previous experience in a service environment preferred
Ability to express a Weird, Wild & Wacky personality to align with company Culture
Ability to work as a team
Ability to understand and carry out verbal and written instructions
Constant standing/walking for duration of shift on a hot cooking line
Part-time hours: 20 - 40 per week
Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Temporary, Permanent
Salary: From $14.35 per hour
Additional pay:
Tips
Benefits:
Company events
Discounted or free food
Flexible schedule
Store discount
Schedule:
10 hour shift
12 hour shift
8 hour shift

Weekend availability
COVID-19 considerations:
All of our Fan's are required to wear masks, Take-out and delivery only, common surfaces are sanitized regularly.
Ability to commute/relocate:

French (preferred)
English (preferred)
